messages.subject: Your creativity, please!
messages.msgSnippet: Long story short, I have been completely exhausted.  I care for two of our grandchildren, 12 and 4 months,  full-time.  Recently, I reduced my commitment by
messages.messageBody:
Long story short, I have been completely exhausted. I care for two
of our grandchildren, 12 and 4 months, full-time. Recently, I
reduced my commitment by two days giving us Wednesdays and Fridays
off. I plan to eliminate Mondays as well in a couple weeks giving
me more time with my three unschoolers that I am still actively
facilitating.

In September they start a local co-op that meets on Fridays, so we
will be limited to Mondays and Wednesdays where I can give them my
full attention. What I would like to do is compile a list of
interesting things to do to keep on the refrigerator with the
intention of enabling us to think more effectively on our toes.

What are your plans for the fall? How do you enjoy spending time
with your young teens? (Ours are 12ds, almost 15ds and 16dd) What
interests you? What interests your teens?

I'm just looking for a creative jump start here so we spend our time
doing more than lunch and a movie. That's nice, but we'd like a
little more variety in our life.

Thanks - Tina
